com.zberman2.DataManager

Class Master

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.zberman2.DataManager.Master

  • public class Master
extends java.lang.Object
    The master class controls the flow of the game. This class describes that flow. Created by Zack Berman on 9/11/2014.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Master()
      No args constructor which initializes a blank standard board, populates a standard list of chess pieces, and adds them to the board.
      Master(Board board)
      Constructor for testing purposes.
      Master(boolean standard)
      Constructor that initializes either a standard master or an alternate master depending on the parameter

      • Master

        public Master()
        No args constructor which initializes a blank standard board, populates a standard list of chess pieces, and adds them to the board.

      • Master

        public Master(boolean standard)
        Constructor that initializes either a standard master or an alternate master depending on the parameter
        Parameters:
        standard - true for standard initialization, false for alternate initialization

      • Master

        public Master(Board board)
        Constructor for testing purposes. Initializes a master with a starting board configuration
        Parameters:
        board - chessboard to be used by the master

    • Method Detail

      • standardMaster

        public void standardMaster()
        Initialization protocol for a standard master. Creates a standard board with standard pieces

        Initialization protocol for an alternate master. Creates a standard board with alternate pieces

      • findPiece

        public Piece findPiece(java.lang.String input)
        Returns the chess piece at a certain space on the board
        Parameters:
        input - string containing a pair of x and y coordinates
        Returns:
        Piece at (file, rank) or null if none exists

      • canMove

        public boolean canMove(Piece piece,
                       java.lang.String input)
        Entry method for the canMove(pieces, file, rank) method Parses the string input and passes it into canMove
        Parameters:
        piece - Piece to be moved
        input - String containing a (file, rank) coordinate pair (i.e. space where piece is going to be moved to)
        Returns:
        true if piece can move to the new location

      • move

        public void move(Piece piece,
                 java.lang.String input)
        Entry method for moving a piece to a new space
        Parameters:
        piece - Piece to be moved
        input - String containing an (file, rank) coordinate pair (i.e. the space where piece is going to be moved to)

      • canMove

        public boolean canMove(Piece piece,
                       char newFile,
                       int newRank)
        Determines if a piece can move to a new location on the board.
        Parameters:
        piece - Piece to be moved
        newFile - file coordinate of new space
        newRank - rank coordinate of new space
        Returns:
        true if moving to (newFile, newRank) is legal

      • move

        public void move(Piece piece,
                 javafx.util.Pair<java.lang.Character,java.lang.Integer> newPosition)
        Entry method for move(newFile, newRank) using a (char, int) pair
        Parameters:
        piece - Piece to be moved
        newPosition - new location on the board

      • move

        public void move(Piece piece,
                 char newFile,
                 int newRank)
        Moves a piece to a new (file, rank) Note, this method is only called if canMove(newFile, newRank) has already been determined to be true
        Parameters:
        piece - Piece to be moved
        newFile - file coordinate of new space
        newRank - rank coordinate of new space

      • isCheck

        public int isCheck(int color)
        Determines if the King of a particular color is in check.
        Parameters:
        color - color of the King we are checking
        Returns:
        0 if he is not in check. 1 for a single check, and 2 for a double check (or more)

      • hasLegalMoves

        public boolean hasLegalMoves(int color)
        Determines if the color passed in as a parameter has any legal moves for its next turn
        Parameters:
        color - white or black
        Returns:
        true if the color has legal moves available

      • kingHasLegalMoves

        public boolean kingHasLegalMoves(int color)
        Determines if the king of the specified color has any legal moves for its next turn
        Parameters:
        color - white or black
        Returns:
        true if the king has legal moves available

      • isCheckmate

        public boolean isCheckmate(int color)
        Determines if the King a particular color is in checkmate, and the game is over
        Parameters:
        color - color of the King we are checking
        Returns:
        true if he is in checkmate

      • isStalemate

        public boolean isStalemate(int color)
        Determines if there is no check, but also no legal moves available
        Parameters:
        color - Team we are checking
        Returns:
        true if the game ends in a stalemate

      • pieceArrayList

        public java.util.ArrayList<Piece> pieceArrayList(int color)
        Accumulates and returns an ArrayList of pieces for a particular color that have not been captured yet
        Parameters:
        color - Team
        Returns:
        ArrayList of color pieces

        Compiles and returns a list of legal moves for a given piece
        Parameters:
        piece - Piece to be moved
        Returns:
